result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel Davis Pedahel

records.addlTxt:
10:14 am - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gabriel Davis Pedahel appeared by video.  Attorney Sara Elizabeth Stertz appeared by video for Gabriel Davis Pedahel. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial. Inducement is for this case to be dismissed and read in if plea entered on 21 CF 457.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Further proceedings on September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjournment Request

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-04-22 at 9:00 a.m.    
Minutes.
Sara Stertz, through Public Defender.

2:58 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gabriel Davis Pedahel appeared by video. Defendant is no longer employed and must re-apply at public defender's office.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 07-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice given to defendant in court on 05-23-22.

3:01 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gabriel Pedahel appearing in person.  Defendant does not qualify for Public defender of court appointed counsel.  Needs time to hire attorney.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Order appointing counsel is denied because the court finds the person is not indigent.

2:13 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gabriel Davis Pedahel in court. PFAC denied by court.  More time needed to hire attorney.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Denying Petition for Appointment of Counsel.
The Court finds the defendant not indigent.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney;  Affidavit of Indigency.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 04-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
RE:  Felony bail jumping, on 03-02-22.

$2,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.
 - Neil Patrick Cavanaugh @ 22307 Poplar Grove Road, Chilton, WI 53014
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-14-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with any persons under 18 years old and have no use of the internet or possess any internet enabled devices.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. 
Copy filed.  
Minutes.
